byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg reported from Baltimore, and Jess Bidgood from Boston. Reporting was contributed by Gary Gately from Baltimore; Ashley Parker from Doral, Fla.; and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JESS BIDGOOD

abstract: Baltimore state's attorney Marilyn J Mosby drops all remaining charges against three police officers still awaiting trial for their role in death of Freddie Gray, ending one of most closely watched police prosecutions in nation with no convictions and few answers about how Gray died; defends her decision, attributing it to impossibility of securing convictions against officers without reform of city's criminal justice system.
lead_paragraph: The prosecutor secured not a single conviction against six officers charged. But she offered a passionate defense of her decision to pursue the case.

headline.main: All Charges Dropped Against Baltimore Officers in Freddie Gray Case
headline.print_headline: Baltimore Case Closed, With No Guilty Verdicts

snippet: The prosecutor secured not a single conviction against six officers charged. But she offered a passionate defense of her decision to pursue the case....
